name: CCMDD - new enrolment
definition: All new STABLE patients with chronic diseases enrolled on the Central Chronic Medicines Dispensing and Distribution (CCMDD) programme for the first time, for the current month
definitionExtended: All CCMDD patients who have received a CCMDD chronic prescription and have not been registered on the programme previously. Facility must supply first cycle of medication
useAndContext: New stable patients with chronic diseases enrolled on the CCMDD programme - first cycle of medication supply provided at the facility
exclusions: If patients clients do not have SA identity, Passport, Asylum seeker number, they are not registered on the programme.
collectedBy: All health establishments that are implementing the CCMDD programme /CDU programmes(Western Cape)

name: CCMDD - renewal
definition: All STABLE patients with chronic diseases with a renewed prescription for the Central Chronic Medicines Dispensing and Distribution (CCMDD)  programme for the current month
definitionExtended: All CCMDD patients who have received a CCMDD chronic prescription and have been registered on the programme previously, including those patients that were dormant and have a renewed CCMDD prescription. Facility must supply first cycle of medication.
useAndContext: Stable patients with chronic diseases re - enrolled on the CCMDD programme - first cycle of medication supply again provided at the facility
inclusions: INCLUDE all patients  that were dormant
exclusions: EXCLUDE patients who do not have SA identity, passport, asylum seeker number, as they are not registered on the programme
collectedBy: All health establishments implementing the CCMDD /CDU programmes(Western Cape)

name: CCMDD client collecting medicine parcel from contracted external PuPs
definition: Central Chronic Medicines Dispensing and Distribution (CCMDD) patients clients who opted to collect their patient medicine parcels from CCMDD contracted external Pick up Points (PuP)
definitionExtended: CCMDD patients registered to collect at contracted External Pickup Points
useAndContext: The external pick up point must be contracted. To quantify the number of new and renewed patients who have opted to collect their medication from external pick up points.

name: Diarrhoea death under 5 years
definition: A child under 5 years who died in a health facility where diarrhoea was documented as the main cause of death (count only the main diagnosis). Where applicable, these deaths must also be counted under SAM deaths and MAM deaths
definitionExtended: Diarrhoea occurs when stools contain more water than normal. Counting separations/deaths due to diarrhoea can be complicated because the condition often coexists with other serious conditions for which data are collected. Where applicable, these deaths must also be counted under SAM deaths and MAM deaths. Count only if diarrhoea was the main cause of death (the main diagnosis). A child can only be recorded as having died from diarrhoea or from pneumonia. The ICD 10 codes are A03, A09.0 and A09.9 .
useAndContext: Monitors the severity and management of diarrhoea in children under 5 years of age.
inclusions: INCLUDE Where applicable, these deaths must also be counted under SAM deaths and MAM deaths (This does not represent double counting as the two data elements should never be added together)
exclusions: EXCLUDE Under five child  diarrhoea death before admission

name: Diarrhoea separation under 5 years
definition: Child under 5 years with diarrhoea as main final diagnosis at separation
definitionExtended: The ICD 10 codes are A03, A09.0 and A09.9 . Diarrhoea occurs when stools contain more water than normal. Counting separations/deaths due to diarrhoea can be complicated because the condition often coexists with other serious conditions for which data are collected, in particular in children with HIV/AIDS
useAndContext: Monitors the severity and management of diarrhoea in children under 5 years of age
inclusions: INCLUDE all children with severe acute malnutrition, moderate acute malnutrition or no acute malnutrition

name: Diarrhoea with dehydration new in child under 5 years
definition: Child under 5 years diagnosed with diarrhoea with some or severe dehydration (IMCI definitions)
definitionExtended: Diarrhoea occurs when stools contain more water than normal. Mothers usually know whether their children have diarrhoea. Dehydration is present when diarrhoea is accompanied by any 2 of the following: Lethargy or unconscious state, sunken eyes, unable to drink/drinking poorly/not drinking eagerly, pinched skin goes back very slowly, restless/irritable and/or thirsty. Only record children presenting for the first time for the current episode of diarrhoea with dehydration (i.e. new case)
useAndContext: Monitors diarrhoea incidence in children under 5 years of age
inclusions: INCLUDE referrals from a private general practitioner
exclusions: EXCLUDE follow-up visits for diarrhoea diagnosed with dehydration during a previous visit;

name: Infant exclusively breastfed at DTaP-IPV-Hib-HBV (Hexavalent) 3rd dose
definition: Infant reported to be exclusively breastfed at DTaP-IPV-HepB-HBV (Hexavalent) 3rd dose immunisation (preferably 14 weeks after birth)
definitionExtended: If immunisation is delayed the data item must still be recorded at the time when DTaP-IPV-HepB-Hib is given. Information should be obtained from the mother/caregiver by means of a 24-hour recall on what the infant drank/ate the previous day (ask specifically about water), and not by using a YES or NO, closed ended question. Only record as exclusively breastfed if the child received breastmilk ONLY (the child may have received medicines/vaccines prescribed by a health professional). A child who has received ANY solids, milk (other than breastmilk) or other liquids (including water) should not be counted. All providers that contribute to the number of hexavalent must report on the number of infants exclusively breastfed
useAndContext: Monitors infants on exclusively breastfeeding up till the age of 14 weeks after birth
inclusions: INCLUDE intake of breastmilk only, and only medications approved by health professional for 1st 6 months
exclusions: EXCLUDE intake of water and formula for first 6 months

name: Inpatient discharge 0-28 days

definitionExtended: This data element is a subset of Inpatient discharge under 5 years
useAndContext: Monitors treatment outcome for admitted children under 5 year of age
exclusions: EXCLUDE the discharge of day clients
